entry.title: SAP Signavio July 2025 Release: SAP Signavio Process Insights and Intelligence
entry.content:
The latest quarterly release of the SAP Signavio Transformation Suite has arrived, delivering new capabilities and key enhancements across Process Intelligence and Process Insights. The July 2025 update introduces smarter ways to uncover inefficiencies, define outcome-driven targets, and turn insights into action. These advancements continue to push the boundaries of process optimization and help you drive meaningful business impact.

Let‚Äôs explore what‚Äôs new in advanced process analysis and mining!

SAP Signavio Process Intelligence

Root Cause Analysis on Event Graphs

In today‚Äôs fast-paced business landscape, true operational excellence demands more than surface-level process metrics ‚Äî it requires a deep, precise understanding of how your processes actually run. That‚Äôs exactly what the new Root Cause Analysis (RCA) on Event Graphs delivers. Building on the foundation of standard RCA, this advanced capability offers a step-level, data-driven view into your operations, identifying exact points of friction such as bottlenecks, rework loops, and inefficient sequences that drain time and resources. Unlike traditional approaches, which often rely on aggregated insights, event graph analysis maps out the true sequence of events, uncovering hidden inefficiencies and providing actionable intelligence for improvement.

Take a real-world scenario: the system might reveal that performing Step A before Step B adds ‚Ç¨14 to your production cost. Simply switching their order not only eliminates that cost but actually unlocks an additional ‚Ç¨2 in savings ‚Äî a ‚Ç¨16 swing from one small change. This kind of visibility and precision empowers businesses to move from broad assumptions to targeted interventions with measurable impact. Powered by AI, this capability reduces time-to-insight and enables organizations to drive smarter, faster decisions that enhance productivity, cut costs, and unlock hidden value at scale. Root Cause Analysis on Event Graphs redefines what‚Äôs possible in process intelligence ‚Äî shifting the conversation from what happened to why it happened, and most importantly, how to fix it and prevent it in the future.

Root Cause Analysis on Event Graphs

Click here to start a step-by-step tutorial for this feature. Want to read more about Automated Root Cause Analysis? Click here to read a blog post about the capability!

Set an improvement percentage for targets in value analysis

When driving transformation initiatives, the way you define success can make all the difference. Traditionally, business users and process owners have set absolute targets for their value cases ‚Äî specific numbers they aim to reach for key metrics. But many forward-looking organizations are shifting toward a more dynamic, flexible approach, thinking in terms of percentage improvements rather than fixed values.

Until now, expressing these relative goals required manual effort. With the latest enhancement to SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, you can now gain a more streamlined and flexible way to handle that scenario. As an analyst you can now directly define value case targets as percentage improvements, allowing for quicker, more intuitive modeling of business cases ‚Äî whether it's reducing your cost per transaction by 10% or boosting throughput by 15%. The system automatically calculates the corresponding absolute values in the background, ensuring accuracy while preserving flexibility. This dual-option capability empowers your teams to align their value modeling with how they actually think about performance improvement ‚Äî supporting both strategic goal setting and operational precision.

Set an improvement percentage for targets in value analysis

 Click here to start a step-by-step tutorial for this feature.

Snowflake Key Pair authentication

As organizations increasingly rely on cloud-based platforms for analytics, data security and compliance have become central to sustainable digital transformation. Recognizing this, SAP Signavio now supports key-pair authentication for Snowflake, offering a more secure and future-ready method of connecting to one of the most widely adopted cloud data platforms in the enterprise space. This enhancement goes beyond traditional basic authentication by introducing a robust, standards-aligned authentication option that strengthens access control and safeguards sensitive process data pipelines.

With this upgrade, organizations can seamlessly ingest data from Snowflake into SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, while ensuring they remain compliant with Snowflake‚Äôs evolving security protocols. Key-pair authentication not only helps maintain uninterrupted connectivity but also delivers enterprise-grade protection ‚Äî giving your IT teams and analysts the confidence that their analytics infrastructure is both secure and aligned with modern best practices.

Snowflake Key Pair authentication

 

SAP Signavio Process Insights

Value Analysis: Ariba Process Performance Indicators

Unlocking value from procurement processes is no longer a guessing game ‚Äî it‚Äôs now a data-driven discipline. With newly enhanced support for SAP Ariba solution data, organizations can now uncover high-impact opportunities across their procurement landscape. This includes visibility into four key performance indicators: unpublished contract workspaces with past effective dates, delayed purchase requisition items, overdue purchase orders, and unresolved supplier invoice exceptions. By quantifying the monetary impact tied to these inefficiencies, teams can move beyond surface-level tracking and make informed decisions that prioritize the highest-value improvements. Whether reducing delays, addressing supplier exceptions, or tightening procurement compliance, this capability empowers process and procurement leaders to drive focused, results-oriented optimization across the entire source-to-pay journey.

 

Want to know more about this release? Check out the highlight blog post and see what else we prepared for this release over the entire SAP Signavio Transformation Suite!

We are looking forward to seeing you on the SAP Signavio Community to share feedback, questions and discuss with your peers! This is your space!

Please feel free to share your questions around the release or feedback in the comments with us. You can also reach out to us via the SAP Signavio Community or alternatively watch our Release Webcast on-demand.

entry.title: Re: Process Integration Pipeline Extension - Restart via Data Store
entry.content:
@philippeaddor thanks for reporting this! yes, it looks like a bug - there is a limit of the Data Store Name - the maximum length allowed for the data store name is 40 characters. We use the fixed suffixes "_Retry" or "_NoRetry", so we need to ensure that the whole Data Store names does not exceed 40 chars when we append those suffixes. We check if Pid or RetryDataStore parameter exceed 34 or 32 chars, and if yes - we have to truncate them to add the suffix (2 scripts: readInterfaceRestartConfFromPD.groovy and readInterfaceNoRestartConfFromPD.groovy lines 30-47). So this truncation is done by "Custom Error Handling with Data Stores" IFlow.
Then Restart job reading Partner Directory data and apparently we append the suffix without check of the Data Store Name length (without truncate). We will provide a fix for this. The workaround in the meantime is to set the restart Data Store in Partner Directory with the name shorter than 32 chars.
thanks for testing it and let us know in case of any further findings.

entry.title: Gaining Operational Insights with the SAP LogServ Workbook on Microsoft Sentinel - Part 4
entry.content:
Find your way to our central blog series entry here.

Dear community,

Following our previous deep-dives into LogServ usage with Microsoft Sentinel for SAP and customization, let's explore the operational insights available through Sentinel's built-in workbook for SAP LogServ monitoring.

Near real-time visibility atyYour fingertips

The SAP LogServ Insights Dashboard on Azure transforms raw log data into actionable intelligence. Navigate to Microsoft Sentinel > Workbooks > Templates and locate the pre-configured dashboard. 

 

Save to your workspace and open to get started. Make sure to select the Log Analytics workspace powering your Sentinel tenant first.

 

 

Key metrics that matter

The workbook provides comprehensive monitoring across four critical dimensions:

  • Total Events: Track log ingestion volumes (4M events shown)
  • Active Systems: Monitor connected hosts (36 active systems)
  • Data Freshness: Near real-time status indicators with color-coded alerts
  • Log Distribution: Understand log ingestion patterns across your SAP landscape components

The Log Volume Timeline reveals ingestion patterns, helping identify peak usage periods and potential anomalies. Notice how the 24-hour view shows consistent data flow with the characteristic SAP workload patterns.

Pay attention to the status legend: Fresh (green), Recent (orange), Older (red), and Stale (dark red). These indicators help SAP Security and SOC teams quickly assess data currency - critical for incident response.

The workbook automatically refreshes, ensuring your security operations center maintains current visibility into your SAP RISE environment's log ingestion health.

Proactive Alert Configuration

Transform workbook insights into actionable alerts using the Create Alert Rule button visible above the timeline. This creates Azure Monitor alerts directly from your LogServ metrics, enabling threshold-based notifications for critical scenarios like data ingestion anomalies or system connectivity issues. Configure alert rules to monitor total event volumes, data freshness status changes, or active system counts falling below expected baselines.

Azure Monitor's alert engine integrates seamlessly with action groups for email, SMS, Microsoft Teams, or webhook notifications to your operations team. For detailed configuration guidance, reference the Azure Monitor alerts documentation.

 

For those of you who prefer PowerBI for dashboarding...

See this Microsoft Learn article how to craft a dashboard from the Microsoft Sentinel queries for SAP LogServ.

 

Final Words

That‚Äôs a wrapüåØ. You saw today how to observe log ingestion health and use data freshness indicators for your SAP LogServ solution in Microsoft Sentinel. The built-in views are easy to extend and customize for your own individual needs.

#Kudos to @Hemanth_Kusampudi and team for the partnership.

Get started with your deployment from here today.

What visuals are most helpful for your daily operations? Do you want special breakdowns for HANA database, and proxy components like the SAP WebDispatcher? Let us know in the comments or reach out directly.

Cheers Martin & Hemanth

entry.title: SAP Signavio July 2025 Product Release - Process Transformation Management and Collaboration
entry.content:
SAP Signavio July 2025 Release Highlights

Explore the latest innovations in the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite, featuring new capabilities in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager and SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub. These updates are designed to help you drive strategic alignment, boost collaboration, and accelerate transformation outcomes.

 

SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager

Introducing Objectives for Initiatives

Driving meaningful transformation starts with clear strategic alignment. The new Objectives feature in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager empowers you to define business objectives that reflect your strategic priorities and directly connect them to your transformation initiatives. You are now able to demonstrate strategic alignment and track the impact of your efforts at every stage, ensuring every initiative contributes to measurable business value.

We're really excited for this feature and it‚Äôs a first step toward helping you move from disconnected execution to purpose-driven transformation, where every effort delivers measurable business value. And we're just getting started, we look forward to enhancing this capability even further in future releases.

Automatically Extracting Data from SAP Signavio Process Insights for Benchmarking Analytics 

Say goodbye to manual data entry! With this release, key process performance indicator (PPI) values from SAP Signavio Process Insights are now automatically retrieved and updated in Benchmarking Analytics in SAP Signavio Process Transformation Manager. This eliminates manual data handling, improves data accuracy and ensures your benchmarking and decision-making are always based on the most current insights.

 

SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub

Redesigned comments with rich text support

Enhancing collaboration and communication has never been easier with SAP Signavio's newly redesigned commenting interface, now featuring rich text support. This scalable solution spans across the Suite, offering users the ability to articulate clearer, more structured feedback through advanced formatting options. By ensuring consistency in communication, this upgrade fosters a unified experience across SAP Signavio products and empowers teams to engage in more productive discussions, ultimately driving effective collaboration and informed decision-making.

AI-assisted role-based process overview (beta program*)

Simply provide your job details, and our role-based process overview capability will suggest roles from your dictionary. Choose the role that best describes your activity, and the capability will automatically display everything relevant to your role in one place, including processes, documents, IT systems, and activities.

The feature provides a personalized experience as users see content relevant to their roles, avoiding the risk of missing important information. It saves time by eliminating manual searches or filtering, allowing users to quickly access the information they need. It also minimizes administrative tasks by reducing manual configuration of role-specific views and access paths.

Read more in our detailed blog on AI

*This capability is currently available SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub and Process Manager customers via a beta program*. To see if you‚Äôre eligible to join the program, contact your customer success representative.

entry.title: SAP Signavio value accelerators: what‚Äôs new in the July release
entry.content:
Delivering measurable value quickly is more important than ever. That‚Äôs why this release of the latest SAP Signavio value accelerators offers powerful capabilities designed to help organizations align strategy with execution, enabling faster insights, smarter decisions, and tangible business outcomes. 

From enhanced benchmarking tools to improved prioritization frameworks, these latest features empower teams to identify high-impact opportunities and act with confidence. Whether you're driving transformation, optimizing performance, or strengthening governance, this release provides the tools to unlock value at speed and scale. 

Read on to explore what‚Äôs new for this July: 

 

Value Accelerator Library 

Improved card design for Value Accelerators in library 

Users exploring the Value Accelerator Library can now quickly grasp key details at a glance thanks to our redesigned cards. This enhancement helps users instantly understand the most important attributes of each Value Accelerator, making it easier to decide which ones fit their needs and deserve a deeper look. 

EnableNow video 

 

Additional clarity and control when installing Value Accelerators without Dictionary 

Transformation professionals who customize value accelerator installations now benefit from clear summaries of their chosen settings before and after installation. This makes it easy to review installation modes, understand dictionary size, and confirm customization steps, helping reduce errors and ensure smoother deployments in customer workspaces. 

EnableNow video 

 

ERP & Business Transformation 

Process design and standardization for SAP SuccessFactors 

Designed for transformation leaders and process consultants who want to ensure alignment with SAP SuccessFactors best practices while effectively modeling to-be processes, this new value accelerator offers SAP best-practice business process models that accelerate fit-to-standard assessments, enhance process understanding, and support a smooth transition to SAP SuccessFactors utilizing SAP Signavio Process Manager. 

EnableNow video 

 

Modeling and navigating through business transformation journeys 

Ready-to-use transformation journeys that empower transformation managers to align stakeholders effectively. By leveraging best-practice methodologies from SAP Activate and Value Management in unified journey models, managers can clearly map out and communicate the entire transformation lifecycle - ensuring better alignment, transparency, and execution across the transformation effort. 

EnableNow video 

 

Improvement opportunity dashboard to reduce data management cost 

IT and business professionals can quickly gain deep insights into common business challenges with the Improvement Opportunity Dashboard in SAP Signavio Process Insights. Designed for first-time users and non-experts, it highlights outdated transactional data and provides actionable recommendations to reduce data management costs. Backed by decades of SAP consulting expertise, this tool saves time by simplifying issue identification and analysis, helping teams plan more accurately and accelerate their migration journeys.

 

Process Landscape & Enterprise Architecture design content for the industries: Aerospace and Defense, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Mill Products and Mining 

This accelerator now includes industry-specific process and enterprise architecture content designed to streamline project scoping and enable the structured design of future-state process architectures. Leverage SAP Signavio Process Manager to align and accelerate ERP transformation efforts with greater precision and efficiency, empowering teams to reduce project risk, increase transparency, and establish a strong foundation for digital transformation. 

EnableNow video 

 

Process design and standardization for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 

Accelerate fit-to-standard assessments and enhance process understanding with SAP‚Äôs latest best-practice business models. Using SAP Signavio Process Manager, teams can more easily compare current and future processes, ensuring stronger compliance and smoother adoption of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502. This approach supports clearer ‚Äúto-be‚Äù process modeling and better-informed decisions throughout the transformation journey. 

 

Process design and standardization for SAP Business Network for Supply Chain 

Enable transformation leaders and process consultants to help ensure alignment with best practices for SAP Business Network for Supply Chain 2505 while effectively modeling to-be processes. Best-practice business process models from SAP can accelerate fit-to-standard assessments, enhance process understanding, and support a smooth transition to version 2505 of SAP Business Network for Supply Chain utilizing SAP Signavio Process Modeler.  

EnableNow video 

 

Process design and standardization for SAP Integrated Business Planning 

Streamline fit-to-standard assessments and deepen process understanding using SAP‚Äôs latest best-practice models. With SAP Signavio Process Manager, teams can more easily compare current and future processes, ensuring compliance and a smoother move to SAP Integrated Business Planning 2502. This empowers clearer to-be process modeling and supports smarter decision-making throughout the transformation 

EnableNow video 

 

Process design and standardization for SAP Ariba 

Transformation leaders and process consultants can accelerate fit-to-standard assessments and improve process understanding using SAP‚Äôs latest best-practice models. Powered by SAP Signavio Process Manager, this approach simplifies comparing current and future processes, ensuring compliance and a smoother transition to SAP Ariba. It enables clear ‚Äúto-be‚Äù process modeling and supports informed decision-making throughout the transformation journey. 

EnableNow video 

 

Supply Chain 

Process flow analyzing internal problem notifications in SAP Quality Management 

Process experts or quality managers can now gain real-time visibility into quality notifications and pending tasks within SAP Quality Management. Identify bottlenecks, accelerate processing, and understand how tasks and recorded items are being used, helping ensure timely resolution and consistent team collaboration. 

EnableNow video 

 

Process flow analyzing complaints against suppliers in SAP Quality Management 

Process experts and quality managers can also gain transparency into processing of quality notifications within SAP Quality Management (QM). Quickly spot bottlenecks, accelerate processing, and monitor how tasks and recorded items are used, ensuring timely resolution and consistent team performance. 

EnableNow video 

 

Process flow analyzing transportation efficiencies in SAP Transportation Management 

Supply chain managers can now tackle complexity and high execution costs by using the transportation process flow analysis in SAP Signavio Process Insights. It helps identify obsolete data, long lead times, and blockers, enabling faster operations, cost reductions, and smoother freight execution through process harmonization and standardization. 

EnableNow video 

 

Process flow analyzing freight settlement in SAP Transportation Management 

Shared service center managers can overcome transparency challenges and cut supply chain costs using the freight settlement process flow analysis in SAP Signavio Process Insights. It uncovers lead times, incorrect status updates, manual rework, and blockers, helping speed up operations and improve accuracy throughout the freight settlement process. 

EnableNow video 

 

Process flow analyzing customer complaints in SAP Quality Management 

Process experts or quality managers can now get real-time transparency into quality notification handling within SAP Quality Management. Identify bottlenecks, accelerate processing, and monitor how tasks and recorded items are used, ensuring timely resolution and consistent team performance. 

EnableNow video 

 

Sales 

Identify improvement potential for lead to quote in non-SAP CRM Systems 

Sales operations managers struggling with inaccurate data and inconsistent quoting can now increase lead and opportunity conversion with the Lead-to-Quote Value Accelerator for non-SAP CRM systems. Extending our existing sales process coverage, sales manager can now dig deeper into their sales processes outside of SAP systems. It uncovers inefficiencies, tracks trends, and analyzes cycle times to streamline processes, helping sales teams close deals faster with ready-to-use, adaptable dashboards. 

EnableNow video 

 

Finance 

Correction recommendations to delay unfavorable supplier payments 

Finance managers seeking greater transparency into payment term usage can leverage the correction recommendation feature to identify unfavorable terms and spot inconsistencies in supplier payments. It reveals if payment terms are changed by users and whether suppliers deliver earlier than expected, guiding improvements to optimize cash flow and supplier relationships. 

EnableNow video 

 

Correction recommendations to reduce obsolete or duplicate supplier payments 

Finance professionals struggling to identify duplicate invoices and payments can use SAP Signavio‚Äôs correction recommendations to pinpoint root causes and highlight cases needing review. This helps minimize payment risks by detecting duplicates and uncovering open payable items linked to canceled invoices, ensuring cleaner, more accurate payment processing. 

EnableNow video 

 

Procurement 

Supplier Journey Model for Source to Pay process 

Procurement transformation teams can now reduce time and effort in creating supplier journey models and optimize supplier experiences with the supplier journey model accelerator provides access to a best-practice journey model that reflects key supplier interactions and moments. This ready-to-use journey can be customized to align with internal procurement processes and supplier relationship goals, enabling teams to fast-track journey modeling, uncover supplier pain points, enhance collaboration and trust across the supply base. 

EnableNow video 

 

Correction recommendations to increase use of best possible and negotiated net prices 

For procurement managers who lack transparency how effective their organization is leveraging best available prices, the ‚Äúcorrection recommendations to increase use of best possible and negotiated net prices‚Äù for SAP Signavio Process Insights provides insights in certain circumstances: when unfavorable prices were used in purchase orders compared to existing purchasing contracts or purchasing information records for the same supplier or material. 

 

Correction recommendations to increase usage of negotiated purchasing contracts 

Procurement managers who are concerned about unused negotiated purchasing contracts, this value accelerator available in SAP Signavio Process Insights provides guidance on the degree to which newly created contracts are used productively. It highlights purchasing contracts that are unused or no longer used, and uncovers purchases made at unfavorable prices. With these insights, teams can improve contract utilization, strengthen compliance, and ensure negotiated terms deliver their intended value. 

 

Standard integration package for SAP Ariba using the Cloud Integration capability within SAP Integration Suite  

Users can now seamlessly connect to SAP Ariba using native 'Cloud Integration' from the SAP Integration Suite. It enables efficient data extraction from SAP Ariba, unlocking powerful insights and process mining for procurement workflows. By reusing preconfigured integration packages and data services, teams can quickly gain visibility into process inefficiencies, drive data-based decisions, and support continuous improvement. 

EnableNow video 

 

Identify improvement potential for source to pay in SAP Ariba 

To improve productivity of procurement managers with this new value accelerator for SAP Signavio Process Intelligence, which enhances process clarity and makes it easy for procurement analysts to quickly gain insights and improve transparency. It delivers ready-to-use dashboards and streamlined templates focused on KPIs, reducing the time needed to analyze cycle times, document volumes, automation rates, and compliance. 

EnableNow video 

 

Improve procure to receipt process performance in SAP Ariba 

This new value accelerator available in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence offers a streamlined template designed to help procurement managers uncover untapped optimization potential in the procure-to-receipt process. Facing challenging process optimization goals from their leadership, yet lacking transparency, procurement teams can now identify root causes of long cycle times and pinpoint impactful improvements. With ready-to-use dashboards and flexible templates, this solution boosts productivity, tracks inefficiencies, and supports continuous process evolution. 

 

Correction recommendations and improvement opportunity dashboard to reduce maverick buying behavior 

Designed for procurement managers battling maverick buying, this new value accelerator in SAP Signavio Process Insights delivers clear visibility into purchasing activities across the organization. It identifies transactions that bypass negotiated contracts and weaken overall purchasing effectiveness, impacting future supplier negotiations. With these insights, procurement teams can quickly understand and address common challenges to reduce maverick buying and strengthen compliance. 

EnableNow video 

 

Conclusions 

The July 2025 SAP Signavio release marks a significant step forward in empowering organizations to drive faster, more confident business transformations. With enhanced usability in the Value Accelerator Library, deeper insights across key use cases like supply chain, finance, procurement, and HR, and powerful new content for industry-specific needs, these innovations deliver measurable value from day one. 

Whether you're designing future-state processes, uncovering hidden inefficiencies, or accelerating fit-to-standard assessments, the expanded suite of value accelerators makes it easier than ever to align strategic goals with operational execution. Combined with best-practice methodologies, SAP Signavio gives transformation leaders the clarity, control, and confidence needed to succeed in today‚Äôs evolving business landscape. 

To check out all the new accelerators mentioned in this blog post, access the value accelerator library, which is embedded into SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite. Find the value accelerator library in the side panel of SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub and get started today.

entry.title: SAP Signavio July 2025 Product Release - Process Governance
entry.content:
SAP Signavio July 2025 Release Highlights

We're excited to share the latest innovations in SAP Signavio Process Governance as part of the July 2025 release. These capabilities are designed to further streamline governance workflows, enhance security, and empower you to work more independently and effectively.

 

Microsoft SharePoint integration workflow action ‚Äì maintenance of files

Ensure seamless document governance and compliance with our new Microsoft SharePoint integration. This feature enables automated, template-based actions to move or delete files within your governance workflows. It simplifies document handling, reduces manual efforts and human error, improves consistency, and ensures secure and compliant management and maintenance of documents within your governance workflow.

Click here to start the step-by-step tutorial for this feature for admins

Click here to start the step-by-step tutorial for this feature for modeler

 

Action interface: SAP Cloud ALM solution integration action

Accelerate your process and implementation lifecycle by automatically synchronizing approved process model revisions from SAP Signavio solutions to SAP Cloud ALM. This reduces manual effort, enhances data consistency, and allows you to configure synchronization based on relevant statuses, bringing greater control and efficiency to process governance while reducing manual effort.

Click here to start the step-by-step tutorial for this feature

 

Migrating connector credentials to the credential store

We‚Äôre also enhancing security and compliance by automatically migrating connector credentials to the secure credential store. This feature eliminates the need for manual credential management, reduces risk, and ensures credentials are stored safely and in alignment with your security and compliance requirements.

 

 

Workflow access governance reports

Empower your users with self-service reporting. With the new access governance report feature, users can independently generate and export data, reducing reliance on support and reducing wait times. To ensure compliance and protect sensitive information, each export request follows the ‚Äúfour-eye principle‚Äù, requiring approval from an organizational administrator to ensure sensitive data is handled responsibly and in accordance with you company policies and security standards.

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process and Journey Modeling: what's new in the July release
entry.content:
Whether you're aiming to speed up model creation, boost transparency, ensure data consistency, or integrate experience insights, SAP Signavio brings more intelligence and usability to every step of your transformation. 

With the July 2025 release, SAP Signavio introduces a powerful set of AI-assisted capabilities and usability enhancements that go far beyond the basics. From improvements to the AI-assisted process modeler and text-to-process functionality, to tighter integration with SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Solution Manager, to new experience analytics powered by SAP Analytics Cloud, this release supports smarter modeling, seamless synchronization, and deeper insight into the journeys that matter. 

Here is a summary of what the new July release brings to you: 

 

AI-assisted process modeler, text to process enhancements (generally available):  

With the process modeler, text to process capability, customers can generate a new process model in seconds starting from a textual description.  Embedded into SAP Signavio Process Manager and generally available since February, this capability has been now further enhanced with three key updates: 

  • Language synchronization: This enhancement facilitates global accessibility and ease of use by aligning the language of the input text with the language displayed in the generated BPMN diagram. Modelers can work comfortably in their preferred language and concentrate on refining their processes without translation concerns. 
  • Dictionary integration (August 2025): When creating process models from plain text, modelers can now easily reuse existing elements from the repository such as systems, organizational units, and other dictionary items, ensuring that the models are more consistent and standardized while duplications are avoided.  
  • Diagram preview zoom: This enhancement enables modelers to closely examine the initial process model, allowing them to zoom in and out and focus on specific areas. The quick identification of areas needing adjustments results in greater accuracy and reduces the time spent on iterative refinements. 

EnableNow video.  

The capability is generally available within SAP Signavio Process Manager and, requires AI units.

 

Transparency on processes synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM 

Process managers can now monitor synchronized models between SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM more efficiently than ever. A detailed central log offers clear visibility into synchronization status, both across all models and at the individual level. This enhanced transparency supports informed decision-making, helping users understand the current state briefly and confidently plan the right next steps to keep processes aligned and up to date. 

 

Avoidance of synchronization without established connectivity with SAP Cloud ALM 

Process managers can now activate "Sync with SAP Cloud ALM" only after a connection is established. This simple improvement prevents unnecessary waiting and errors, helping users keep workflows efficient and focused on what truly matters. 

 

Identify dimensions and values of process variants synchronized to SAP Solution Manager 

This new feature enhances Variant Management synchronization from SAP Signavio to SAP Solution Manager through the identification of process variant dimensions and their values by the connector in SAP Signavio, and the synchronization of these elements to SAP Solution Manager. This powerful capability provides users with a clear and structured view of variant-template relationships and associated dimensions, thus supporting more accurate process configuration, improved and thorough testing, and enhanced documentation quality. By reducing errors and making critical variant information easily accessible, this feature empowers teams to make better informed decisions and maintain smooth, reliable operations. 

 

Joule, SAP AI co-pilot (Early Adopter Care program) 

Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI co-pilot, is integrated with SAP Signavio and available to select customers through the Early Adopter Care program, which has been extended to November 2025. While new Joule skills are released monthly, the July release introduces a new set of transactional skills specifically for variant management. With these skills, users can manage templates and variants directly through conversational interactions, streamlining operations and accelerating process updates. Following the July release, Joule is now directly accessible in both SAP Signavio Process Manager and SAP Signavio Journey Modeler. 

 

Experience analysis and monitoring with metrics from SAP Analytics Cloud 

Journey owners and analysts can now gain a full view of personas‚Äô experiences by embedding SAP Analytics Cloud widgets directly within each journey step. This integration combines process, customer experience, and operational data, enabling more informed, data-driven decisions for transformation initiatives. With predefined data embedding, teams save time and costs while gaining powerful insights to drive business performance. 

 

Conclusions 

The July 2025 release reinforces SAP Signavio‚Äôs commitment to delivering intelligent, user-centric capabilities that drive real transformation. With expanded AI-assisted features, to improved synchronization to SAP Solution Manager and embedded experience analytics via SAP Analytics Cloud, this release empowers users to model faster, work smarter, and make more informed decisions across the process landscape. 

By improving language support, reusability through dictionary integration, synchronization transparency, and user experience across modeling and monitoring, SAP Signavio helps organizations boost operational efficiency, maintain alignment across tools, and elevate customer experiences. These advancements represent a significant step forward in making process excellence more accessible, actionable, and impactful. 

Adopting these innovations enables organizations to stay agile, reduce complexity, and lead with confidence in their transformation journeys. 

If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about the rest of the SAP Signavio solutions, check out the blog posts below:   

  • SAP Signavio July 2025 Release Highlights   
  • Process Analysis and Mining   
  • Value accelerators
  • New AI capabilities and enhancements   
  • Process Transformation Management and Collaboration   
  • Process Governance

entry.title: Navigating Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) in Today‚Äôs Business Environment
entry.content:
In complex regulatory and business environments, organizations are under growing pressure to manage risks, ensure compliance, and uphold strong governance practices. Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) is the strategic framework designed to meet these demands‚Äîhelping businesses align IT with corporate objectives, manage risk proactively, and ensure compliance across an increasingly complex regulatory landscape.

What is GRC?

Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) is a coordinated strategy for managing an organization's overall governance, enterprise risk management, and compliance with regulations. GRC provides a structured approach to decision-making by integrating risk, compliance, and performance data across departments. When effectively implemented, GRC helps reduce uncertainty, control costs, mitigate IT and security risks, and improve overall business performance.

What‚Äôs Driving the Need for GRC Today?

Organizations face big waves in diverse, fast-moving risks‚Äîfrom cybersecurity threats to geopolitical disruptions‚Äîcreating a need for real-time risk awareness and accountability. At the same time, global regulatory frameworks are becoming more demanding and complex, with increasing expectations around transparency and internal controls.

Digital transformation of businesses introduces both opportunity and risk. Real-time processes, machine learning, robotic process automation (RPA), and increased collaboration across organizational boundaries demand new approaches to monitoring, assurance, and control. Traditional, manual GRC practices are no longer sufficient in this dynamic environment.

GRC and SAP‚Äôs Secure Operations Map

In SAP‚Äôs Secure Operations Map (SOM), GRC is embedded in four critical domains:

  • Security Governance
  • Risk Management
  • Regulatory Process Compliance
  • Audit & Fraud Management

This integration provides a foundational structure to ensure GRC principles are applied consistently across IT, finance, and operations.

GRC in the Context of the Secure Operations Map (SOM)

Why Do Organizations Need GRC Tools?

Many organizations still manage internal controls and compliance processes manually‚Äîusing spreadsheets, shared drives, emails, and physical binders. This fragmented approach leads to delays, errors, outdated information, and in some cases, missed control testing. This is especially concerning given the need for CEOs and CFOs to sign off on financial statements under personal liability.

GRC tools centralize and automate these processes, providing:

  • A unified view of internal controls across the enterprise
  • Timely and accurate compliance data
  • Reduced risk of financial misstatements or regulatory breaches
  • Greater efficiency in audits, due diligence, M&A, and IPO processes

The objective is clear: ensure operational consistency, identify irregularities or non-compliance, and build a resilient and trustworthy organization.

Example control - Record-to-Report Process

Implementing a GRC Strategy: Key Steps

1. Define the Purpose and Scope

An effective GRC strategy begins with defining its purpose and scope. Organizations need to determine whether the approach will be applied enterprise-wide or focused on high-risk areas such as finance, IT, or third-party relationships. Objectives such as improving audit readiness, meeting regulatory requirements, and reducing operational risk should be clearly defined from the outset.

2. Establish a Governance Structure

The next step is to establish a governance structure. This involves forming a cross-functional GRC steering committee with representatives from compliance, legal, IT, HR, and business leadership. Responsibility for managing risks, maintaining policies, overseeing controls, and handling reporting must be clearly assigned. A dedicated GRC lead should be appointed to coordinate implementation and ensure consistency across departments.

3. Conduct a Risk and Compliance Assessment

A risk and compliance assessment follows. This assessment identifies internal and external risks, maps relevant regulations such as GDPR, HIPAA, and SOX, and evaluates existing compliance gaps. A risk register is developed to classify risks based on their likelihood and potential impact on the organization.

4. Develop and Document Policies and Controls

With the risks identified, the organization can develop and document appropriate policies and controls. These cover areas such as data protection, access management, and anti-fraud measures. Each risk is linked to corresponding control measures, and responsibilities are assigned using a controls matrix to ensure clear traceability.

5. Select and Deploy a GRC Tool

Selecting and deploying a GRC tool is essential for effective execution. The tool should centralize risk and compliance data, support integration with existing systems such as HR, ERP, and incident reporting platforms, and automate key tasks such as alerts, workflows, and compliance tracking. A pilot rollout helps test the setup in a controlled environment before broader deployment.

6. Train and Communicate

Training and communication play a key role in supporting your GRC framework. Employees receive role-specific training on relevant policies and how to report concerns. Internal awareness efforts help foster a culture of compliance and accountability. Managers are provided with tools such as dashboards to monitor compliance within their teams.

7. Monitor, Audit, and Continuously Improve

To keep the GRC strategy effective, organizations must implement ongoing monitoring, regular audits, and continuous improvement. This involves scheduled control testing, internal audits, and the use of key risk indicators to track changes and emerging issues. Reviewing incidents, near misses, and evolving regulations ensures the GRC framework remains current and effective.

Steps for Implementing a GRC Strategy

Tools for GRC in Hybrid SAP Landscapes: Introducing SAP Risk and Assurance Management (RAM)

SAP‚Äôs traditional GRC suite‚Äîincluding Process Control (PC) and Risk Management (RM)‚Äîis tightly integrated with on-premise ERP systems. However, in today‚Äôs cloud and hybrid environments, their capabilities can be limited.

Enter SAP Risk and Assurance Management (RAM): a modern GRC platform designed for hybrid landscapes, including S/4HANA Cloud (both Public and Private Editions). SAP RAM enables organizations to:

  • Leverage a single platform for multiple use cases across the enterprise
  • Turn GRC from a compliance burden into a strategic differentiator
  • Focus resources on high-impact risks, processes, and regulations
  • Continuously monitor control performance using real-time business data
  • Improve compliance and control effectiveness while reducing operational costs

By automating labor-intensive tasks like control testing, RAM not only enhances assurance quality but also frees up internal audit and compliance teams to focus on what matters most.

Example Process Flow in RAM

Final Thoughts

GRC is no longer just a back-office function‚Äîit has become a critical enabler of strategic agility, operational resilience, and trust in the digital age. With a well-defined strategy, clear governance structure, and tools like SAP Risk and Assurance Management, organizations can shift from reactive compliance to proactive risk management and business optimization. As part of this evolution, integrating GRC with security monitoring is essential. Giving responsible teams access to timely and accurate security information strengthens their ability to detect potential threats and respond effectively. Auditing and monitoring tools further enhance this by measuring the success of GRC efforts and highlighting areas for improvement. In the next blog post, we‚Äôll explore how SAP supports real-time security monitoring and auditing‚Äîturning insight into action to improve enterprise security and compliance.

entry.title: BUILD Work Zone - HTML5 Business Solutions vs HTML5 apps using saas_approuter
entry.content:
I just came across the idea of HTML5 Business Solutions in SAP Work Zone.

Developing HTML5 Business Solutions as Content Providers | SAP Help Portal

Federation of HTML5 Business Solutions | SAP Help Portal

Checking the use cases, it feels that this is target for partner apps when it comes to multitenancy. However there is the possibility to create single tenant apps. 

Based on that I have a few general questions: 

1) Is it possible to create a single tenant solution containing only the front end part of an app? (similar to a HTML5 app using saas_approuter)? If yes, what would be the advantages/main differences on doing so? Any sample repositories are appreciated.

2) A bit of futurology, is it possible that HTML5 apps created using saas_approuter will be deprecated in favor of HTML5 Business Solutions? I ask that mainly after Roadmap item "Automatic content refresh for integrated HTML5 applications after update" not targeting saas_approuter but only Business Solutions

If anyone from SAP can explain what was the concept behind Business Solutions, specially a single tenant scenario are very appreciated. Are such apps internally handled differently? Is there any relevant difference on the managed router of such scenarios?

Thanks in advance,

entry.title: Six new AI capabilities you don‚Äôt want to miss to speed up and simplify your process transformation
entry.content:
AI-assisted business process transformation is now a reality. Discover how SAP Signavio‚Äôs new release brings the power of AI to business process management.  

Imagine empowering your process modelers and analysts with solutions that can help them model process diagrams and gain process insights faster than ever allowing to focus more on high-value tasks and decision making.

Well, you don‚Äôt need to imagine anymore. This release introduces new AI-assisted capabilities and enhancements designed to further speed up and streamline your transformation initiatives, making process modeling and mining faster, easier and more accessible to a wider audience of non-technical users.  The release also includes beta versions of an AI-assisted role-based process overview and a context analyzer for both sentiment analysis and text-to-event matching. Both of these capabilities are now available to SAP Signavio customers through beta programs. 

Let's dive into the AI innovations introduced in the July release of the SAP Signavio Process Transformation Suite and what‚Äôs coming soon... 

1. Faster process diagram creation with AI-assisted process modeler enhancements  

SAP Signavio customers can already leverage our AI-assisted process modeler, text to process capability, which allows them to generate a new process model in seconds starting from a text description. Embedded into SAP Signavio Process Manager since February, this capability has now been further enhanced with three additional improvements: 

  • Language synchronization: Now you can write your input text in different languages and automatically generate process diagrams in that language. This means modelers can work comfortably in their preferred language and concentrate on refining their processes without translation concerns. 
  • Dictionary integration (expected August 2025): When creating process models from plain text, modelers will be able to leverage this capability to easily reuse existing elements from the repository such as systems, organizational units, and other dictionary items. This ensures that models are standardized, and duplications are avoided.
  • Diagram preview zoom: Process modelers can now closely examine their initial process models by zooming in and out to focus on specific areas. This allows them to quickly identify where adjustments are needed, resulting in greater accuracy and less time spent on iterative refinements.

The AI-assisted process modeler capability is available in SAP Signavio Process Manager; activation requires AI units. 

2. Personalized content with the new AI-assisted role-based process overview (beta program*) 

Our new AI-assisted role-based process overview within the SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub offers personalized content tailored to each user‚Äôs specific role.  

Role-based process overview

Our onboarding wizard allows users to specify their job role details from a list of suggestions. The role-based process overview will then display the content that‚Äôs most relevant for the user on a single page, including processes, documents, IT systems, and activities.  This creates a personalized experience that allows users to focus on the information that is relevant to them. It also makes it less likely that important details will be missed, and you no longer need to waste time with manual searches or setting up role-specific dashboards yourself. 

This capability is currently available to SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub and Process Manager  customers via a beta program. To see if you‚Äôre eligible to join the program, contact your customer success representative. Places are limited. 

3. Understanding the why with automated root cause analysis on event graphs  

Understanding how your processes really work is key to achieving operational excellence. Deep diving into the root cause of your inefficiencies can become essential to adapt and thrive. This is where AI root-cause analysis on event graphs makes a difference.  

The functionality delivers actionable insights, empowering you to make confident changes that drive measurable improvements. This allows you to: 

  • Gain granular understanding of bottlenecks: Pinpoint exact steps causing delays or inefficiencies
  • Identify inefficient sequences: Recognize patterns that lead to rework or wasted effort
  • Target process improvements: Focus on specific areas with the highest potential impact
  • Enhance overall efficiency: Optimize workflows to boost productivity and reduce costs

Read more here.

Click here to start a step-by-step tutorial for this feature.

The capability is generally available within SAP Signavio Process Intelligence. 

4. Close the gap between process and experience perspective with the AI-assisted context analyzer (beta program*) 

Our new AI-assisted context analyzer within SAP Signavio Process Intelligence uses artificial intelligence to interpret vast amounts of unstructured process data and connect it back to specific process steps. Initially, this will focus on experience data from customers or employees, helping you augment your existing process mining analysis with insights on customer experience at every step. 

The capability includes two features, both available as part of a dedicated beta program: 

  • Sentiment analysis: provides instant categorization of customer feedback from surveys, comments, emails, and other sources into positive, negative, or neutral sentiments 
  • Text-to-event matching: recommends matches between free text data and events,  while clearly representing customer experience data within process dashboards so that users can intuitively understand how each process step is experienced.

Text-to-event matching

The unique aspect of this capability is that users can analyze unstructured data like experience records directly within the process context without leaving their SAP Signavio process mining tool. Process experts and analysts can explore key process stages, identify experience bottlenecks, and understand exactly why customers feel the way they do along a process. This isn't just about analyzing text; it's about connecting real customer feedback with the underlying processes and acting on those insights within minutes.  

Click here to start a step-by-step tutorial for this feature

SAP Signavio Process Intelligence customers can access this capability via a beta program. To see if you‚Äôre eligible to join the beta program, contact your customer success representative. Places are limited. 

5. Accurate findings with AI-assisted content search (beta program, starting September 2025*) 

With more than 3,000 metrics, hundreds of recommendations, and pages of reference guides, SAP Signavio Process Insights provides a huge amount of content to users. By integrating an AI-assisted semantic search, SAP Signavio Process Insights can now offer users a more intuitive and efficient way to discover relevant content.   Unlike traditional keyword-based searches, semantic search comprehends the context and meaning behind user queries, interpreting their unique terminology and intent to deliver more accurate results. With this capability, users can find more relevant results while avoiding information overload. 

Starting September 2025, this capability will be available to SAP Signavio Process Insights customers via a beta program. To see if you‚Äôre eligible to join the beta program, contact your customer success representative. Places are limited. 

6. Manage variants with Joule, SAP AI co-pilot (Early Adopter Care program) 

Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI co-pilot, is integrated with SAP Signavio and available to select customers through the Early Adopter Care program, which has been extended to November 2025. New Joule use cases are released monthly, and the August release will introduce a new set of transactional skills specifically for variant management. With these skills, users can manage templates and variants directly through conversational interactions, streamlining operations, and accelerating process updates. Following the August release, Joule will be accessed directly through both SAP Signavio Process Manager and SAP Signavio Journey Modeler by customers who are part of the Early Adopter Care program. 

Start leveraging AI-assisted business process management today 

With this enhanced range of AI-assisted capabilities, SAP Signavio empowers you to achieve greater operational efficiency, enhanced customer experience, and accelerated process transformation. By adopting these AI-assisted features, organizations can unlock new levels of productivity, accuracy, and agility, securing their place at the forefront of process excellence and transformation. 

Contact your SAP Signavio customer success representative to learn more about generally available features or to join our beta programs. Otherwise, you can book a demo of all SAP Signavio capabilities to see what you‚Äôre missing:  

Book a demo

*SAP Beta Testing programs provide you with early access to SAP software to test and see how it fits your business requirements. Beta shipments are provided under a Test and Evaluation Agreement (TEA) and can be used for testing purposes only. Productive usage is not allowed and is not supported under the maintenance and support agreement.

entry.title: Overhead cost allocation in Public Cloud: Alternative to CPTD ‚Üí KSII ‚Üí CON2?
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP R/3 to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

In our current R/3 system, we use the following process to allocate and revalue production-related costs:

CPTD ‚Äì Template allocation for planned activity quantities and costs (model costing).

KSII ‚Äì Actual cost rate calculation for cost centers.

CON2 ‚Äì Revaluation of production/process orders with actual rates.

This flow allows us to dynamically allocate actual costs (especially labor, depreciation, and other overheads) to production orders at period-end based on actual quantities.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, we understand that:

Template allocations (CPTD) are not available.

KSII and CON2 are not available as classic transactions, although some similar functionality may exist through Fiori apps.

Costing sheets (percentage-based overhead surcharges) are available.

We are also using Material Ledger with actual costing activated in our Public Cloud system.

Our questions are:

Is there any standard equivalent to CPTD + KSII + CON2 in Public Cloud for dynamic overhead allocation?

Is the only available option to use overhead surcharges via costing sheets (e.g. percentage-based rates on cost elements)?

Can we define fixed surcharges or simulate dynamic allocation without model costing or actual rate revaluation?

We have seen that actual rate calculation (KSII) does exist in Public Cloud and works with Material Ledger. Could you confirm how the postings look (e.g. cost center to production order, price differences, etc.) and what journals are involved?

If KSII works in Public Cloud: Where do we configure the splitting structure for cost center allocations (like YA1, method 12 in R/3)? We could not find a corresponding SSCUI or configuration path.

Any help or references to standard configuration would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Journey Through Data Migration in an SAP BRIM Implementation
entry.content:
Dear @MANJU_BHAVSAR -
Thank you for your feedback! You're absolutely right. Pre-load validation and post-load reconciliation are crucial. In our case, building "pre-load" validation jobs was very critical.

During the initial mock cycles, we had instances where data was migrated without any technical errors, yet issues arose during downstream processing. For example, Solution Quotations were successfully migrated, but errors occurred when processing them further to generate Subscription Contracts / Provider Contracts. A typical example would be missing rate card data required to match the CCM assignments of specific product.

As part of our ‚Äúlessons learned‚Äù from mock cycles, we had prepared a detailed checklist of validation points - covering data mismatches, missing data, dependency checks, and more. We had built ETL jobs to perform these checks prior data upload.

entry.title: Re: Foreign Currency Exp - inconsistency between To Bill...
entry.content:
Hi,

The inconsistency between To Bill and Cost amounts in Project Currency for foreign currency expenses in the Manage Project Billing App is primarily caused by currency conversion timing differences and pricing date configuration [1].

Root Cause: When there is a difference between the transaction currency of the cost posting and the document currency of the project billing request, the pricing date of the cost posting is taken into consideration for currency conversion in Transfer Costs Only scenarios [2]. This means that exchange rates applied at different dates can result in varying converted amounts.

Configuration Solution: Your SD expert's approach to update the pricing date configuration to "A - Date of services rendered" in the condition types for pricing is correct. The system supports Standard and B (Price date) as values for Pricing Date configuration [1]. This ensures consistent currency conversion by using the same reference date (service rendered date) for both To Bill and Open Amount calculations.

Important Considerations:

  1. Repricing Requirements: If you maintain any pricing condition other than PC01 and use Transfer Costs Only configuration, you must execute the repricing job to get the correct To Bill amount for each line item when single expense postings with multiple line items are made [2][1].

  2. Configuration Changes: After making pricing date configuration changes, you may need to run the repricing job to apply the changes to existing postings, especially if there are partially postponed or written-off items [2].

  3. Ongoing Issues: The red inconsistencies appearing when posting additional foreign expenses suggest that:

    • New postings may require repricing job execution
    • Exchange rate fluctuations between posting dates and service rendered dates continue to cause variations
    • Additional configuration validation may be needed

[1] Manage Project Billing

[2] Configuration Setting for Project Billing Profile 

Best regards, Dequan Xu

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate E-Invoice in sap public cloud 3SL wi...
entry.content:
To integrate e-invoicing in SAP Public Cloud 3SL using third-party providers, follow these key steps:

  1. Understand Local Regulations: Ensure compliance with country-specific e-invoice formats and tax requirements, such as Peppol (EU), CFDI (Mexico), or FatturaPA (Italy).
  2. Select a Third-Party Provider: Choose a certified third-party provider with experience in SAP Cloud integrations. Popular options include Peppol and EDI platforms like OpenText or SPS Commerce.
  3. Leverage SAP BTP: Use SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) as middleware. SAP Integration Suite (CPI) facilitates communication between SAP Cloud and third-party systems via REST/SOAP APIs or file-based transfers.
  4. Map Data and Generate XML: Set up SAP Output Management to generate compliant e-invoices (usually in XML format). You may need to use Adobe Forms or custom transformations for correct data formatting.
  5. API or File-Based Integration: Integrate with the third-party provider using their API (for real-time processing) or file transfer methods (FTP/SFTP) for batch invoicing.
  6. Test Thoroughly: Always test in sandbox environments to ensure that the integration is functioning correctly, particularly with data formats, invoice generation, and compliance checks.
  7. Monitor and Maintain: Set up error handling and monitoring via SAP BTP to track the success or failure of each e-invoice, ensuring smooth operations post-implementation.

By following these steps, businesses can streamline their invoicing process and meet local e-invoicing regulations effectively.

entry.title: Build Shipment Creation and Tracking Skill using Joule Studio integrated SAP BN4L GTT
entry.content:
As we know by now, Joule is SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot that helps users interact with business data and processes in a conversational, natural language format. With Joule Studio, developers and business users alike can create custom Joule skills to address specific business scenarios, extending the power of SAP Business AI.

With the latest launch of Joule Studio, we can now build custom AI agents and skills that automate workflows and improve efficiency in executing routine tasks. Joule Studio is currently live with the Skill builder and the Agent Builder is slated to be GA later this year. 

Earlier this year, I had the privilege to work with the Joule Studio product teams to build and test Logistics Agents for providing transportation options, fetching weather forecasts on transportation routes and tracking with carriers in real-time.

In this article, we will walk through the steps on how to build Joule Skills for Logistics and Transportation use cases using Joule Studio. These custom skills will help users create a shipment directly in SAP Business Network for Logistics (BN4L) and subsequently track that shipment‚Äôs status using Global Track and Trace (GTT) using the Joule digital assistant.

This is particularly useful for transportation planners, customer service reps, and warehouse operators who want a quick and intelligent way to interact with shipment data in natural language - without navigating through multiple systems. Furthermore, once the Joule is activated in S/4HANA systems or SAP Build Workzone then Joule can create shipments directly in BN4L GTT using the data from ERP orders/deliveries. 

Step 1: Prerequisites

Before building the skill in Joule Studio, ensure you have activated the following:

  • Joule Studio on your SAP BTP subaccount. (refer provisioning Joule Studio)

  • SAP Business Network for Logistics tenant with API access. 

  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub to reference GTT APIs. 

  • Authentication credentials for SAP BN4L API endpoints. 

  • Developer role and permissions to create skills in Joule Studio.   

 

Step 2: Design the Skill in Joule Studio

Login to your SAP Build lobby to create a Joule Skill. 

Skill to Create Shipment in BN4L GTT

Step 1: Create a new Joule skill and provide a valid description which will help as the trigger mechanism. Add input parameters to the skills to capture Source Location, Destination Location, Pickup Date, Shipment No, etc. 

We can even make this optimizer this step further by fetching an ERP delivery data from a S/4HANA System using the Odata Service. With that Joule will be able to fetch the delivery details to create a shipment. However, to understand how the conversations work, we can proceed with capturing data from the user.  

Step 2: Create and Publish a Build Action from Build Lobby to integrate your BN4L GTT tenant with SAP Build. 
Here, we can use the GTT Write Service API (Shipment Event) which creates a shipment in GTT (For more info visit SAP Help)

Step 3: Add the published Action to Joule Skill and map the Skill input to Action input. 

Step 4 (Optional): Add Send Message function to display a successful shipment creation message to the User along with a hyperlink to navigate GTT shipment to v. 

Step 5: Deploy and Test the Joule Skill using the Build Environments. Currently, Joule Studio supports testing the custom Joule Skills only from within an Environment. Under Joule, launch the standalone Joule Digital Assistant. 

 

Step 3: Joule digital assistant (the conversation part) 

Use Joule digital assistant to test the skill that we just deployed. Open the logs to review the steps performed by Joule to execute a Skill based on user input. 

Create a shipment conversation with basic shipment information. 

 

Skill to Track Shipment using BN4L GTT

Step 1:  Return to SAP Build Lobby and open your project, within the project create a new Joule Skill. Remember to add a wholesome description. Add input - trackingId and output parameters -status, city, region. 

Step 2: Add a new Build Action to fetch shipment status from GTT. To find more details of the GTT Read services in the BN4L GTT Reference Guide.

Release and Publish the Action to be used in Joule Skill. 

Refer to the SAP BPA help to learn more on how to use $filter capability while querying using an Odata service. 

Step 3: Add this Action as a step function in the Track Shipment Joule Skill. Map the Action input to the Skills Input to pass the tracking number from the user as a query parameter to the GTT read service. This will improve the overall performance and response time of Joule during runtime conversations. 

Create a new destination variable to represent the GET service BTP destination. 

Step 4: In the End step, map the Skills Output to the corresponding fields from the Action Output result. This will enable Joule to form a logical output based on the message to be displayed to the user.  

Step 5:  Release and deploy the skill to the same Environment created for the first skill. 

Step 6: Navigate to the Environment, now you should be able to see the latest version of the Project deployed. Launch the Joule DA from the Joule tab. 

Step 3: Joule digital assistant (the conversation part) 

Track the shipment with Shipment ID to view the execution status and the current location. 

Step 4: Integrate Joule with SAP Build Workzone

Enable your users to interact with Joule and enjoy these custom skills by activating Joule in SAP Build Workzone.  

Final Thoughts

This is an high level overview on building custom Joule Skills for deterministic tasks based on business processes expanding the horizon of SAP Business AI. With Joule Studio, we are now able to extend SAP Joule's AI capabilities to address unique business needs. 

Learn more about how SAP Premium Engagement can help you accelerate your digital transformation with curated AI workshops and discovery sessions. 

SAP Business AI Joule SAP Business Network for Logistics SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition @SAPMaxAttention

entry.title: Re: Developing with SAP Integration Suite - "Configure" n...
entry.content:
Hello Franziska,

Try this out once:

First, you need to assign role collections:

  1. APIManagement.SelfService.Administrator

  2. APIPortal.Administrator

For this, go to Security (in BTP Cockpit) ‚Üí Users (select your user) ‚Üí Click on Role Collections ‚Üí Assign Role Collections

Here, you need to select the above two role collections.

Then, clear your cache, and when you log in after clearing the cache, you will find API under Settings in Integration Suite.

When you click on API under Settings, it will take some time for provisioning.

Once it's completed, you should see the 'Configure' menu option in your Integration Suite.

Regards,
Harsha

entry.title: Re: send sales order from a particular plant into backord...
entry.content:
Dear @Neha_Singh,

In the Shipping point change the working hours as required (only first half time) for the required plant.

Then activate the Alternative based confirmation(ABC), with the Binding rule "MAX_EARLIER_CONFIRMATION" and maintain the Substitution strategy accordingly.

Once the above configuration is done, when the sales order is created afternoon. system confirms the quantity on the next day for the plant 1(Working only half day), this will trigger the ABC and change the next plant.

Hope this helps!!

Best Regards,

entry.title: Re: How to overwrite the item description in the BOM?
entry.content: If you're testing in CSKB, note that item description won‚Äôt update unless the procedure is triggered during configuration. Make sure the BOM item is part of a configurable material with a valid configuration profile. Avoid trying to overwrite control fields like item category or node number, SAP restricts those. You can find a detailed walkthrough here in SAP‚Äôs guide on changing master data with dependencies, which explains how reference characteristics and procedures interact with BOM fields like POTX1.

entry.content:

When we are checking the contract cashflow whose end of term if 31/12/2030 under "Conditions" we can check the cash flow till 31/12/2027 but not beyond that. Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Report to Check the Overall cashflow of REFX Contract...
entry.content:
Thank you for your question!

The default cash flow period calculation setting is 2 years for all contract types.
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the default CF period calculation cannot be adjusted in the contract type configuration. This setting influences the number of cash flow items generated for each single contract. Depending on the specific contract constellation (e.g. number of objects and conditions per contract, condition rhythm, ...) it would generate a large number of cash flow items which could impact performance system wide.

To see the cash flow calculation until the end of term you can use the app 'Cash Flow - Information System' - REISCDCF where cash flow can be calculated for more than 2 years in advance, using the field 'Calculation To' in the selection screen.

Please also refer to relevant KBA 3629281 on this topic.
